description.label: Description
description.value: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

description.label: Description
description.value: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

description.label: Description
description.value: A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one‑handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.

If the kobold is adjacent to at least one enemy, the kobold Strides up to 30 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. They must end this movement in a space that’s not adjacent to any enemy.
The kobold trapmaster deploys one spike trap in an adjacent square.
The kobold trapmaster deals an extra [[/r 1d6 #precision]] damage to creatures that have the flat-footed condition.

Once this trap is deployed in a square, it deals [[/r 2d8 # piercing]] piercing damage to anyone who steps on that square and they must attempt a DC 17 basic Reflex saving throw. A hero takes no damage on a critical success, half damage on a success, full damage on a failure, and double damage on a critical failure.
